title: Ex Falso Quodlibet
description:
Prove that `False` implies any proposition. This is the principle of explosion (ex falso quodlibet).

**Goal:** `forall P : Prop, False -> P`

In Coq, `False` is an inductive type with no constructors. If you have a hypothesis of type `False`, you can use `destruct` on it to close any goal, since there are no cases to consider.
hints: Use `intros` to introduce P and the False hypothesis
Since False has no constructors, destruct immediately closes the goal
template:
Theorem false_implies_anything : forall P : Prop, False -> P.
Proof.
  (* Your proof here *)
Admitted.
solution:
Theorem false_implies_anything : forall P : Prop, False -> P.
Proof.
  intros P H.
  destruct H.
Qed.
